title: 114_s1352
content: The Act may be cited as the "Children of Fallen Heroes Scholarship Act". Calculation of eligibility is outlined in the Act. Section 473(b) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include eligibility criteria for students who are children of fallen heroes. The amendment specifies that the parent or guardian must have been a member of the Armed Forces and died as a result of military service in Iraq or Afghanistan after September 11, 2001. The amendment to Section 473(b) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 expands eligibility criteria for students who are children of fallen heroes. It includes provisions for children of public safety officers who died in the line of duty. The amendment to the Higher Education Act of 1965 expands eligibility criteria for students who are children of fallen heroes, including public safety officers who died in the line of duty. Financial aid administrators are required to verify student eligibility, adjust family contributions, and notify the Secretary of adjustments. Additionally, students receiving increased Federal Pell Grant amounts are treated differently under this section. The amendment to the Higher Education Act of 1965 expands eligibility criteria for students who are children of fallen heroes, including public safety officers who died in the line of duty. Students receiving increased Federal Pell Grant amounts are exempt from calculating educational assistance benefits under the Public Safety Officers' Benefits program. The definition of a public safety officer includes individuals serving as recognized officers or fire police officers according to state or local law. The amendment to the Higher Education Act of 1965 expands eligibility criteria for children of fallen public safety officers. These officers are officially recognized members of a public safety agency and provide scene security or direct traffic in response to emergencies or special events. The amendment to the Higher Education Act of 1965 expands eligibility criteria for children of fallen public safety officers. SEC. 3. CALCULATION OF PELL GRANT AMOUNT. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to adjust Pell Grant amounts for eligible students meeting specific requirements. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to adjust Pell Grant amounts for eligible students meeting specific requirements. The increase calculated under paragraph (7)(B) for that year is provided only to the extent that funds are specifically provided in advance in an appropriation Act for that award year. Eligibility for certain amounts made available under paragraph (7)(A) is restricted for such students. The Budgetary Effects of this Act will be determined by the latest statement for compliance with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010. The Act and its amendments will take effect on July 1, 2015.
